definitions.text: (comparative and superlative of `early') more early than; most early
examples: a fashion popular in earlier times
his earlier work reflects the influence of his teacher
Verdi's earliest and most raucous opera

definitions.text: at or near the beginning of a period of time or course of events or before the usual or expected time
examples: early varieties of peas and tomatoes mature before most standard varieties

definitions.text: being or occurring at an early stage of development
of an early stage in the development of a language or literature
examples: the Early Hebrew alphabetical script is that used mainly from the 11th to the 6th centuries B.C.
Early Modern English is represented in documents printed from 1476 to 1700
look for an early end to the negotiations
he called me the day before but your call had come even earlier
her parents had died four years earlier
Come a little sooner, if you can
why didn't you tell me in the first place?
